ğŸ¦œğŸ“¹LangChain v0.1.0 YouTube Series

We released a series of videos walking through the seven main components of our new v0.1.0 release

We also added notebooks (in both Python and JS) for a hands-on coding experience for all of them

item.title: RT acai: Congrats to @LangChainAI and @hwchase17 on the big milestone! I've been working with Langchain since last January and it's been amazing to wa...
item.description:
RTâ€‚acai
Congrats to @LangChainAI and @hwchase17 on the big milestone!

I've been working with Langchain since last January and it's been amazing to watch it grow over the last year.

Looking forward to seeing what this year brings!

item.title: RT virat: Earlier today, @LangChainAI announced LangGraph. LangGraph lets us build language agents as graphs. The interface is pretty clean. And I jus...
item.description:
RTâ€‚virat
Earlier today, @LangChainAI announced LangGraph.

LangGraph lets us build language agents as graphs.

The interface is pretty clean.

And I just used LangGraph to build a financial agent graph.

My graph has two tools:
â€¢ extract ticker from user query
â€¢ get latest price for theâ€¦ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744480232487211513

item.description:
ğŸ¦™Local Model Quickstart

One big point of feedback we've gotten is people want more documentation for how to use local models in chains

As part of v0.1.0 we've updated our getting started to now highlight running OSS models!

We also have a section on RAG with local models,â€¦ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744456737678397920

item.title: RT june: Just did a simple 'needle in the haystack' test with this and it's been pretty impressive! I hid a little random sentence within Paul Graham'...
item.description:
RTâ€‚june
Just did a simple 'needle in the haystack' test with this and it's been pretty impressive! I hid a little random sentence within Paul Graham's essay and tested if it can effectively retrieve it. (continued below)


LangChain:â€‚ğŸ€Improved RAGatouille <> LangChain Integration

We really enjoyed @bclavie's new RAGatouille library. It makes advanced retrieval techniques (like ColBERT - more on that below) really easy to use

We've worked on a tighter integration to make it *super simple* to use RAGatouilleâ€¦ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1744080648481260015
item.author: LangChain
